DataElement.preferredName: Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation Unrelated Or Umbilical Cord Blood Tissue Donor Not Institution::National Marrow Donor Program Identifier
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An identifier assigned to a non-NMDP hematopoietic cell transplantation unrelated or umbilical cord blood tissue donor.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation Unrelated Or Umbilical Cord Blood Tissue Donor
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)_The replacement of tissue with tissue from the person's own body or from another person._Not connected or associated e.g. by kinship._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._Blood from the placenta (afterbirth) that contains high concentrations of stem cells needed to produce new blood cells._Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.):The grafting of tissues from one individual to another or place to place within a single individual.

Concepts.definition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)
Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species.

Property.preferredName: Unrelated Or Umbilical Cord Blood Donor
Property.preferredDefinition: Unrelated; not connected or associated e.g. by kinship.:Or; used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Blood present in the umbilical vessels at the time of delivery. If cryopreserved at birth, cord blood can serve as a source of autologous lymphocytes for transplantation to a patient later diagnosed and treated for leukemia or lymphoma.:Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

Concepts.definition: Not connected or associated e.g. by kinship.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

Blood present in the umbilical vessels at the time of delivery. If cryopreserved at birth, cord blood can serve as a source of hematopoietic progenitor cells for transplantation to a patient later diagnosed and treated for a hematopoietic disorder.
Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Body tissue, region, surface, cavity, fluid, organ, or collection of organs.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Not Institution::National Marrow Donor Program Identifier

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:An established society, corporation, foundation or other organization founded and united for a specific purpose, e.g. for health-related research as, a literary institution; also, a building or the buildings occupied or used by such organization.:One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.

An established society, corporation, foundation or other organization founded and united for a specific purpose, e.g. for health-related research; also used to refer to a building or buildings occupied or used by such organization.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ReferenceDocuments.description: Non-NMDP unrelated donor / cord blood unit ID:

ReferenceDocuments.name: BRIDG mapping for CDE:2889049
ReferenceDocuments.description: [for donor] PerformedSubstanceExtraction > Subject [donor] > SubjectIdentifier.identifier WHERE SubjectIdentifier.typeCode IS NOT "NMDP identifier" OR [for cord blood unit] PerformedSubstanceExtraction > Biologic [harvested cord blood unit] > Subject > SubjectIdentifier.identifier WHERE SubjectIdentifier.typeCode IS NOT "NMDP identifier"
